    Welcome

    Written by Rodrigo Farinha on 14 May 2025

    Why I‚Äôm Starting This Blog

    I‚Äôve been thinking about having a personal blog for a long time. I always told myself I‚Äôd start ‚Äúlater‚Äù‚Äîwhen life was less hectic or when my ideas felt more solid. But ‚Äúlater‚Äù never came. And still, the urge to share thoughts kept coming back. So here we are.

    This first post is a simple note to myself (and to anyone else reading) about why this blog exists‚Äîand maybe just as importantly, why it doesn‚Äôt.

    What This Blog Isn‚Äôt

    There are many reasons I‚Äôm starting this blog, but before getting into them, I think it‚Äôs helpful to be clear about what I‚Äôm not trying to do here:

    • I‚Äôm not chasing an audience. I‚Äôm not trying to grow a following or optimize for clicks and keywords. If that were the goal, I‚Äôd probably be better off using Substack.
    • I‚Äôm not picking a single topic. My interests jump around‚Äîfrom strategy to AI, tech, books, and whatever else is on my mind.
    • I‚Äôm not setting a strict schedule. Some months I might write a lot; others, nothing at all‚Äîand I‚Äôm okay with that.

    So Why Write?

    Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs pushing me to hit ‚Äúpublish‚Äù:

    1. To think out loud.
      Writing helps me organize and question my own ideas. Sharing them adds a little pressure to make sense.

    2. To improve how I write.
      You don‚Äôt learn to write by waiting for perfect sentences; you learn by writing imperfect ones, publicly squirming, then doing it again.

    3. To keep track of what I care about.
      This blog is a public memory of things I found interesting or important at the time I wrote them.

    4. To open the door to new conversations.
      Maybe someone reads a post, relates to it, and decides to get in touch. That alone makes it worth it.

    What You Might Find Here

    This won‚Äôt be a highly curated publication. Think of it more like a notebook I‚Äôve left open on the table. Topics will probably include:

    • Artificial intelligence ‚Äî ideas, tools, and things that break.
    • Business strategy ‚Äî especially where it connects with marketing, innovation, or behavior.
    • Technology and tools ‚Äî scripts, apps, experiments that help me work or think better.
    • Reading notes ‚Äî thoughts on books, papers, or articles that stuck with me.

    What Comes Next

    I don‚Äôt know how often I‚Äôll write or how polished things will be. But I‚Äôll try to keep it honest.

    If something here sparks a thought‚Äîor a disagreement‚Äîfeel free to reach out.

    Rodrigo Farinha

    PhD in Marketing. Consultant & Scholar focused on go-to-market strategy, digital transformation, and innovation, particularly in agribusiness and B2B sectors.
